intro: Convolvulus nummularius, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The leaves are round and silvery-gray, giving the plant its common name, and they are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and runners.
